author: bmanikm
body:
- [x ] Resolves issue #1631.

Revert the changes made in #1457 as PSEdition rename is a breaking change for Windows Server 2106 RTM Users.
Only Desktop and Core are the PowerShell Edition names.
Remove Linux as edition name.

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body:
Before this change, $PSVersionTable would tell us the OS - that was very useful in getting repro details.  After this change, we won't have that, so we'll need to ask for additional info when creating an issue.

Should we add some OS identification in PSVersionTable?

comments.author: bmanikm
comments.body:
@lzybkr I am fine with adding an additional entry in $PSVersionTable to convey the OS identification.
Please note that the existing PSEdition values doesn't convey OS X, Cent OS and other supported OS identification.

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body: Let's track OS in PSVersionTable as an issue: https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/1635

comments.author: jianyunt
comments.body:
It was nice to see which OS I am running from the $PSVersionTable.  But we can create a separate item from this change for the OS info.

---

In reply to: [237415699](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/pull/1633#issuecomment-237415699) [](ancestors = 237415699)

title: Revert the changes made in #1457. Desktop and Core are the PowerShell Edition names. Remove Linux as edition name.
